Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class SecureCryptoConfig

java.lang.Object
org.securecryptoconfig.SecureCryptoConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
SecureCryptoConfigInterface
public class SecureCryptoConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements SecureCryptoConfigInterface
Encapsulates Cryptography Use Cases, Configuration, and Parsing Logic of the Secure Crypto Config. Implements the SecureCryptoConfigInterface.
Author:
Lisa

    • SecureCryptoConfig

  • Method Details

    • setSecurityLevel

      public static void setSecurityLevel​(int level)
      Set the latest Secure Crypto Config file of a specific Security level for usage. Algorithms that are used for executing the invoked cryptographic use case are looked up in the latest Secure Crypto Config file (according to its version) with the specified Security level
      Parameters:
      level - : integer of desired security level of Secure Crypto Config file
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • getUsedSCC

      public static java.lang.String getUsedSCC()
      Return the name of the Secure Crypto Config file that is currently used to look up algorithms to use for executing cryptographic use case
      Returns:
      SCCFilePath: path to the used Secure Crypto Config file

    • setCustomSCCPath

      public static void setCustomSCCPath​(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Set path to a custom root folder "scc-configs" which contains the Secure Crypto Config files.
      Parameters:
      path - : path to "scc-config" directory. Path should end with \\
      Throws:
      java.nio.file.InvalidPathException

    • setSCCFile

      public static void setSCCFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
      Set Secure Crypto Config file to use
      Parameters:
      filePath - : path to the Secure Crypto Config file to use
      Throws:
      java.nio.file.InvalidPathException

    • setDefaultSCC

      public static void setDefaultSCC()
      Set default Secure Crypto Configuration using Secure Crypto Config files at "src/scc-configs" Only necessary if a custom path with setCustomSCCPath(Path) or setSCCFile(String) was called before

    • getEnums

      protected static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getEnums()
      Put all values from AlgorithmIDEnum in a Set
      Returns:
      hashSet

    • setAlgorithm

      public static void setAlgorithm​(SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm algorithm)
      Set a specific algorithm for the execution of the later performed use cases. Possible choices are containes in SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      algorithm - : choice of one specific supported algorithm for the following performed use cases.

    • defaultAlgorithm

      public static void defaultAlgorithm()
      Use the algorithms proposed in the currently used Secure Crypto Config file for the execution of the performed use cases. Only necessary if specific algorithm was set previously via SecureCryptoConfig#setAlgorithm(AlgorithmID)

    • encryptSymmetric

      public SCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key, PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException
      Description copied from interface: SecureCryptoConfigInterface
      Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[])
      Specified by:
      encryptSymmetric in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
      Parameters:
      key - : SCCKey
      plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException - : If SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric

    • encryptSymmetric

      Description copied from interface: SecureCryptoConfigInterface

      Specified by:
      encryptSymmetric in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException

      public boolean validateHash​(PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, AbstractSCCHash hash) throws COSE.CoseException
      Description copied from interface: SecureCryptoConfigInterface
      Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.
